title: News regarding OmniCorp Global
story_body:
OmniCorp Global Appoints New VP of Supply Chain Operations

OmniCorp Global (NYSE: OMNI) announced today the appointment of Sarah Chen as Vice President of Supply Chain Operations, effective January 15. Chen will report directly to Chief Operating Officer Michael Torres and oversee the company's global logistics and procurement functions.

Chen joins OmniCorp from Meridian Industries, where she served as Senior Director of Global Logistics for the past four years. She brings over 15 years of experience in supply chain management, having previously held positions at Vertex Solutions and Pinnacle Manufacturing.

"Sarah's extensive background in optimizing complex supply chains will be valuable as we continue to enhance our operational efficiency," said Torres in a statement. "Her expertise in implementing data-driven logistics solutions aligns well with our strategic priorities."

In her new role, Chen will be responsible for streamlining OmniCorp's supplier relationships across its 14 manufacturing facilities and managing the company's $2.3 billion annual procurement budget. She will also lead the integration of recently acquired distribution centers in Ohio and Tennessee.

Additionally, OmniCorp announced that several members of its executive team will attend the Global Business Innovation Summit in Chicago next month. Chief Technology Officer Lisa Patel is scheduled to participate in a panel discussion on digital transformation in traditional industries. The company will also host a booth showcasing its latest enterprise software solutions.

The company separately unveiled plans for its "OmniCorp Cares" community initiative, pledging to donate refurbished computer equipment to local schools in markets where it operates. The program aims to provide 5,000 devices to underserved communities over the next two years, with an initial rollout planned for spring 2024.

"Supporting digital literacy in our local communities is an important part of our corporate responsibility efforts," said Amanda Richardson, OmniCorp's Director of Community Relations. "This initiative represents a practical way to give back while addressing the technology gap in education."

OmniCorp Global, headquartered in Atlanta, provides enterprise technology solutions and consulting services to Fortune 500 companies across multiple industries. The company reported revenues of $8.7 billion in its most recent fiscal year.
